welcome.title: Welcome!
welcome.description: CoolCline is a proactive programming assistant that enhances your development workflow with advanced AI capabilities. It helps you write code more efficiently, optimize queries, auto-fix errors, run command-line tasks, and perform browser automation tests.
welcome.apiProviderNeeded: To get started, this extension needs an API provider.

welcome.title: What can I do for you?
welcome.description: CoolCline is a proactive programming assistant that enhances your development workflow with advanced AI capabilities. It helps you write code more efficiently, optimize queries, auto-fix errors, run command-line tasks, and perform browser automation tests.

messages.executeCommand: CoolCline wants to execute this command:
messages.question: CoolCline has a question:
messages.searchDirectory: CoolCline wants to search this directory for

customization.title: Custom Modes: Celebrating Our New Identity
customization.description: To mark this new chapter, we're introducing the power to shape CoolCline into any role you need! Create specialized personas and create an entire team of agents with deeply customized prompts:

examples.qa: QA Engineers who write thorough test cases and catch edge cases
examples.pm: Product Managers who excel at user stories and feature prioritization
examples.ui: UI/UX Designers who craft beautiful, accessible interfaces
examples.reviewer: Code Reviewers who ensure quality and maintainability

customization.getStarted: Just click the notebook icon to get started with Custom Modes!

join.title: Join Us for the Next Chapter
join.description: We can't wait to see how you'll push CoolCline's potential even further! Share your custom modes and join the discussion at

autoApprove.title: Auto-approve
autoApprove.description: Auto-approve allows CoolCline to perform actions without asking for permission. Only enable for actions you fully trust.

readFiles.label: Read files and directories
readFiles.description: Allows access to read any file on your computer.

editFiles.label: Edit files
editFiles.description: Allows modification of any files on your computer.

executeCommands.label: Execute approved commands
executeCommands.description: Allows execution of approved terminal commands. You can configure this in the settings panel.

useBrowser.label: Use the browser
useBrowser.description: Allows ability to launch and interact with any website in a headless browser.

useMcp.label: Use MCP servers
useMcp.description: Allows use of configured MCP servers which may modify filesystem or interact with APIs.

switchModes.label: Switch modes & create tasks
switchModes.description: Allows automatic switching between different AI modes and creating new tasks without requiring approval.

retryRequests.label: Retry failed requests
retryRequests.description: Automatically retry failed API requests when the provider returns an error response.

input.dragImages: , hold shift to drag in images

language.title: Language
language.description: Set the AI assistant's response language, the interface will also switch to the selected language

customInstructions.title: General Behavior Instructions
customInstructions.description: These instructions apply to all modes as base behavior guidelines, which can be extended by mode-specific instructions below
customInstructions.loadFrom: Instructions can also be loaded from

modePrompts.title: Prompt Settings
modePrompts.description: Hit the + to create a new custom mode, or just ask CoolCline in chat to create one for you!
modePrompts.name: Name

slug.title: Identifier
slug.description: A unique identifier used in URLs and file names, should only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens

roleDefinition.title: Role Definition
roleDefinition.description: Define CoolCline's expertise and personality traits for this mode, which will determine its working style and behavior
roleDefinition.createDescription: Define the expertise and personality traits for this mode

apiConfig.title: API Configuration
apiConfig.description: Select API configuration for this mode
apiConfig.enhancePrompts: You can select an API configuration specifically for prompt enhancement

tools.title: Available Tools
tools.cannotModify: Tools for built-in modes cannot be modified
tools.selectTools: Select which tools this mode can use
tools.selectDescription: Select which tools this mode can use

customInstructions.title: Mode-specific Instructions
customInstructions.description: Add behavioral guidelines specific to {mode} mode
customInstructions.loadFrom: Mode-specific instructions for {mode} can also be loaded from
customInstructions.createDescription: Add behavioral guidelines specific to this mode

configProfile.title: Configuration Profiles
configProfile.description: Configure API profiles for quick switching between providers in the chat input bar

enhance.label: Prompt Enhancement
enhance.description: Get more precise suggestions and improvements through prompt enhancement. This ensures CoolCline accurately understands your intent and provides the best response. Available via the ‚ú® icon in chat interface.

explain.label: Code Explanation
explain.description: Get detailed explanations of code snippets, functions, or entire files. Suitable for understanding complex code or learning new programming patterns. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

fix.label: Issue Fix
fix.description: Help identify and resolve program errors, bugs, or code quality issues, providing step-by-step fix guidance. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

improve.label: Code Optimization
improve.description: Get code optimization suggestions, best practices, and architectural improvements while maintaining functionality. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

addToContext.label: Add Context
addToContext.description: Add supplementary information to current task or conversation. Used for providing additional explanations or clarifying details. Available through smart suggestions (lightbulb icon) or right-click menu in editor.

description.part1: enables communication with locally running MCP servers that provide additional tools and resources to extend CoolCline's capabilities. You can use
description.part2: or ask CoolCline to create new tools specific to your workflow (e.g., "add a tool that gets the latest npm docs").

enable.title: Enable MCP Servers
enable.description: When enabled, CoolCline will be able to interact with MCP servers for advanced functionality. If you're not using MCP, you can disable this to reduce CoolCline's token usage.

serverCreation.title: Enable MCP Server Creation
serverCreation.description: When enabled, CoolCline can help you create new MCP servers via commands like "add a new tool to...". If you don't need to create MCP servers you can disable this to reduce CoolCline's token usage.

timeout.title: Network Timeout
timeout.description: Maximum time to wait for server responses

apiKey.title: API Key
apiKey.storedLocally: API key is stored securely on your local machine

configProfile.title: Configuration Profile
configProfile.description: Save different API configurations to quickly switch between providers and settings

anthropic.name: Anthropic
anthropic.title: Anthropic API Key
anthropic.getKey: You can get an Anthropic API key by signing up here.

modelConfig.title: Model Configuration
modelConfig.description: Configure model capabilities and pricing information

capabilities.title: Model Capabilities
capabilities.description: Configure the capabilities and pricing for your custom OpenAI-compatible model
capabilities.warning: Be careful for the model capabilities, as they can affect how CoolCline can work

maxTokens.title: Max Output Tokens
maxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens the model can generate in a response

contextWindow.title: Context Window Size
contextWindow.description: Total tokens (input + output) the model can process. This will help CoolCline Code run correctly

imageSupport.title: Image Support
imageSupport.description: Enable if the model can process and understand images in the input. Required for image-based assistance and visual code understanding
imageSupport.note: Allows the model to analyze and understand images, essential for visual code assistance

computerUse.title: Computer Use
computerUse.description: Enable if the model can interact with your computer through commands and file operations. Required for automated tasks and file modifications
computerUse.note: This model feature is for computer use like sonnet 3.5 support

pricing.title: Model Pricing
pricing.description: Configure token-based pricing in USD per million tokens

inputPrice.title: Input Price
inputPrice.description: Cost per million tokens in the input/prompt. This affects the cost of sending context and instructions to the model

outputPrice.title: Output Price
outputPrice.description: Cost per million tokens in the model's response. This affects the cost of generated content and completions

openaiNative.name: OpenAI Native
openaiNative.title: OpenAI API Key
openaiNative.getKey: You can get an OpenAI API key by signing up here.

bedrock.name: AWS Bedrock
bedrock.title: AWS Bedrock
bedrock.description: Use AWS Bedrock's AI model service

openRouter.name: OpenRouter
openRouter.title: OpenRouter API Key
openRouter.compressPrompts: Compress prompts and message chain to context size

vertex.name: Google Vertex AI
vertex.title: Google Vertex AI
vertex.description: To use Google Cloud Vertex AI, you need to 1) create a Google Cloud account ‚Ä∫ enable the Vertex AI API ‚Ä∫ enable the desired Claude models, 2) install the Google Cloud CLI ‚Ä∫ configure Application Default Credentials.

mistral.name: Mistral
mistral.title: Mistral API Key
mistral.getKey: You can get a Mistral API key by signing up here

ollama.name: Ollama
ollama.title: Ollama
ollama.description: Ollama allows you to run open-source language models locally

lmstudio.name: LM Studio
lmstudio.title: LM Studio
lmstudio.description: LM Studio allows you to run models locally on your computer. For instructions on how to get started, see their quickstart guide. You will also need to start LM Studio's local server feature to use it with this extension.

vscode.name: VS Code
vscode.title: VS Code LM API
vscode.description: Use VS Code's built-in language model API
vscode.noModels: The VS Code Language Model API allows you to run models provided by other VS Code extensions (including but not limited to GitHub Copilot). The easiest way to get started is to install the Copilot and Copilot Chat extensions from the VS Code Marketplace.
vscode.experimentalNote: Note: This is a very experimental integration and may not work as expected. Please report any issues to the CoolCline GitHub repository.

deepseek.name: DeepSeek
deepseek.title: DeepSeek API Key
deepseek.description: Use DeepSeek's high-performance AI model service
deepseek.getKey: You can get a DeepSeek API key by signing up here

common.modelCapabilityNote: Note: CoolCline uses complex prompts and works best with Claude models. Less capable models may not work as expected.

autoApprove.title: Auto-Approve Settings
autoApprove.description: The following settings allow CoolCline to automatically perform operations without requiring approval. Enable these settings only if you fully trust the AI and understand the associated security risks.

readOnly.title: Always approve read-only operations
readOnly.description: When enabled, CoolCline will automatically view directory contents and read files without requiring you to click the Approve button.

write.title: Always approve write operations
write.description: Automatically create and edit files without requiring approval

delay.title: Write delay
delay.description: Delay after writes to allow diagnostics to detect potential problems

browser.title: Always approve browser actions
browser.description:
Automatically perform browser actions without requiring approval
Note: Only applies when the model supports computer use

retry.title: Always retry failed API requests
retry.description: Automatically retry failed API requests when server returns an error response

mcp.title: Always approve MCP tools
mcp.description: Enable auto-approval of individual MCP tools in the MCP Servers view (requires both this setting and the tool's individual "Always allow" checkbox)

modeSwitch.title: Always approve mode switching & task creation
modeSwitch.description: Automatically switch between different AI modes and create new tasks without requiring approval

execute.title: Always approve allowed execute operations
execute.description: Automatically execute allowed terminal commands without requiring approval

commands.title: Allowed Auto-Execute Commands
commands.description: Command prefixes that can be auto-executed when "Always approve execute operations" is enabled.

viewport.title: Viewport size
viewport.description: Select the viewport size for browser interactions. This affects how websites are displayed and interacted with.

screenshot.title: Screenshot quality
screenshot.description: Adjust the WebP quality of browser screenshots. Higher values provide clearer screenshots but increase token usage.

sound.title: Enable sound effects
sound.description: When enabled, CoolCline will play sound effects for notifications and events.

diffStrategy.name: Use experimental diff strategy
diffStrategy.description: When enabled, CoolCline will use a more advanced diff strategy that can handle more complex code changes. This is still experimental and may not work correctly in all cases.

terminalOutput.title: Terminal output limit
terminalOutput.description: Maximum number of lines to include in terminal output when executing commands. When exceeded lines will be removed from the middle, saving tokens.

diff.title: Enable editing through diffs
diff.description: When enabled, CoolCline will be able to edit files more quickly and will automatically reject truncated full-file writes. Works best with the latest Claude 3.5 Sonnet model.

matchPrecision.title: Match precision
matchPrecision.description: This slider controls how precisely code sections must match when applying diffs. Lower values allow more flexible matching but increase the risk of incorrect replacements. Use values below 100% with extreme caution.

experiments.title: Experimental Features
experiments.description: Enable or disable experimental features that are still under development

DIFF_STRATEGY.name: Use experimental unified diff strategy
DIFF_STRATEGY.description: Enable the experimental unified diff strategy. This strategy might reduce the number of retries caused by model errors but may cause unexpected behavior or incorrect edits. Only enable if you understand the risks and are willing to carefully review all changes.

SEARCH_AND_REPLACE.name: Use experimental search and replace tool
SEARCH_AND_REPLACE.description: Enable the experimental search and replace tool, allowing CoolCline to replace multiple instances of a search term in one request.

INSERT_BLOCK.name: Use experimental insert content tool
INSERT_BLOCK.description: Enable the experimental insert content tool, allowing CoolCline to insert content at specific line numbers without needing to create a diff.

footer.description: If you have any questions or feedback, feel free to open an issue at
footer.resetStateDescription: This will reset all global state and secret storage in the extension.
